name: Skill Extraction Quality Rubric

criteria.name: Skill-Worthiness
criteria.description: Content extracted justifies creating a skill (reusable process, recurring problem)

scoring.1: Not skill-worthy; trivial, single-use, or duplicate content
scoring.3: Skill-worthy for specific domain; limited broader applicability
scoring.4: Clearly skill-worthy; solves recurring problems in multiple contexts
scoring.5: Exceptionally skill-worthy; broadly applicable, fills clear gap

criteria.name: Extraction Completeness
criteria.description: All essential components extracted from source material

scoring.1: Missing critical components (purpose, methodology, or quality criteria)
scoring.2: Some key components present but incomplete
scoring.3: Core components extracted; minor gaps acceptable
scoring.4: Comprehensive extraction of all major components
scoring.5: Complete extraction including nuances, edge cases, and context

criteria.name: Workflow Clarity
criteria.description: Skill workflow is actionable, sequential, and understandable

scoring.1: Workflow is unclear, missing steps, or non-actionable
scoring.2: Workflow present but vague or hard to follow
scoring.3: Clear workflow with actionable steps; some ambiguity
scoring.4: Very clear workflow; each step well-defined and executable
scoring.5: Crystal clear workflow with decision points, inputs/outputs explicit

criteria.name: YAML Description Quality
criteria.description: Description focuses on WHEN to use (situations/triggers), not WHAT it does

scoring.1: Describes what skill does, not when to use it
scoring.2: Mix of what/when; mostly describes functionality
scoring.5: Perfect trigger-based description; user knows exactly when to invoke

criteria.name: Abstraction Level
criteria.description: Content appropriately abstracted from source to be reusable

scoring.1: Too specific to source context; not generalizable
scoring.3: Good abstraction; applicable beyond original context
scoring.5: Perfectly balanced abstraction; specific enough to be actionable, general enough to be reusable

criteria.name: Resource Organization
criteria.description: Resources (template, methodology, examples, rubric) are appropriate and well-organized

scoring.1: Missing required resources or poorly organized
scoring.2: Basic resources present but incomplete or redundant
scoring.3: Good resource structure; all required files present
scoring.5: Perfect resource architecture; each file serves clear purpose, no redundancy

criteria.name: Template Utility
criteria.description: Template (if present) provides clear quick-start value

scoring.1: No template or template is not useful
scoring.2: Template present but too vague or complex
scoring.4: Excellent template; clear structure and guidance
scoring.5: Exceptional template; fills-in-the-blank simplicity with smart defaults

criteria.name: Quality Criteria
criteria.description: Rubric/quality criteria enable validation of skill outputs

scoring.2: Vague quality criteria; hard to assess
scoring.3: Clear quality criteria covering main dimensions
scoring.5: Exceptional criteria; nuanced, revealing, enable continuous improvement

criteria.name: Distinctness
criteria.description: Skill is distinct from existing skills; not duplicate or highly overlapping

scoring.3: Some overlap but differentiated use cases
scoring.5: Completely unique; fills previously unmet need

criteria.name: Guardrails Quality
criteria.description: Do/Don't guidance prevents common mistakes and ensures quality

scoring.5: Exceptional guardrails; anticipate subtle issues, enable mastery

criteria.name: Structure Compliance
criteria.description: Skill follows Claude Code skill structure guidelines

scoring.1: Does not follow guidelines; major structural issues
scoring.5: Exemplary structure; could serve as reference example

criteria.name: Context Efficiency
criteria.description: Skill respects file size limits and uses progressive disclosure

scoring.1: Exceeds file size limits; poor token efficiency
scoring.2: Within limits but inefficient; lots of redundancy
scoring.3: Good efficiency; respects limits with minor redundancy
scoring.5: Optimal efficiency; maximum value per token, perfect progressive disclosure

criteria.name: Actionability
criteria.description: User can execute workflow independently without guessing

scoring.1: Cannot execute independently; too many gaps
scoring.2: Requires significant inference or external knowledge
scoring.3: Mostly actionable; some ambiguity at decision points
scoring.4: Fully actionable; all steps executable independently
scoring.5: Exceptionally actionable; anticipates questions, removes all ambiguity

criteria.name: Source Fidelity
criteria.description: Skill accurately represents source methodology without distortion

scoring.1: Significant distortion or misrepresentation of source
scoring.4: High fidelity; preserves essential intent and detail
scoring.5: Perfect fidelity while improving clarity and usability

overall_assessment.minimum_standard: Average score ≥ 3.5 AND no individual criterion < 3.0

usage_instructions: Rate each criterion independently on 1-5 scale. Calculate average. If average < 3.5 OR any criterion < 3, revise before delivering skill to user. Focus revision on lowest-scoring criteria first.
